CONJUGATES: leave | left | left | leaving (for the verb sense)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'left' (direction, meaning 'weak, useless'). For the verb sense, it is the past tense and past participle of Old English 'læfan' (to allow to remain, leave behind).

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sth] is on the left | turn left
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: describes a noun; adverb: describes a verb, adjective, or other adverb; noun: a person, place, thing, or idea
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On or towards the side of the body that is generally less dominant, or to the west when one is facing north.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She always sleeps on her left side of the bed. | Turn left at the next intersection to reach the library.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她总是睡在床的左侧。| 在下一个路口左转就能到图书馆。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb: an action word; past tense: refers to an action completed in the past; past participle: a verb form used to create perfect tenses and passive voice.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Past tense and past participle of 'leave'; meaning to go away from a place, or to have something remaining.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 离开；剩下；留下 (动词leave的过去式和过去分词)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He left his keys on the table. | There was only a little food left in the fridge.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他把钥匙忘在桌子上了。| 冰箱里只剩下一点点食物了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a person, place, thing, or idea; adjective: describes a noun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group or party favoring liberal, progressive, or socialist policies, often associated with the left side of a legislative assembly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 左翼；左派 (政治上，通常指支持自由主义、进步主义或社会主义政策的团体或政党)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She identifies strongly with the political left. | The candidate's left-wing policies gained significant support.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她强烈认同政治上的左派。| 这位候选人的左翼政策获得了大量支持。
